column4: hi. so here's my problem: after Windows decided to screw its NTFS header, I ran a fixmbr/fixboot on it. obviously, this destroyed GRUB. so I tried by many ways reinstalling GRUB, however it seems to refuse to see my ext3 partition.
are you sure you still have an ext2 partition ?
I can mount it from the live CD yes
in the live CD mount it on /mnt  and then run    sudo grub-install --root-directory=/mnt /dev/sda
you can look at /proc/partitions  to see what the disk address it
done, I'll be back if it still doesn't boot.
i'll expect you when i see you comming
black screen with blinking cursor. probably what remains of Windows' boot loader
no grub error at all ?   no 99 99 99 99 or  17   or nothing ?
try installing from a grub shell maybe
you can run grub as a shell just like you would bash or tcsh    it hs command line editing and simple help messages with tab completion.
you were trying the extended partition not a logical drive within it...  that happens
I was trying (hd0,5) 15 minutes earlier too, and it was saying "no such partition"
yay. alright, well, thanks for the heip anyway.
